qas.question: What popular property in Monopoly was actually a misspelling?
What is the name of the original property that Marvin Gardens takes its name from?
Whose game did Parker Brothers model the board game after?
In what year did Parker Brothers acknowledge and apologize for a spelling error in the game?
Who copied Charles Todd's Monopoly board?

context: <a0_0>Marvin Gardens<a0_0/>, the leading yellow property on the board shown, is actually a misspelling of the original location name, "<a1_0>Marven Gardens<a1_0/>". The misspelling was said to have been introduced by Charles Todd and passed on when his home-made Monopoly board was copied by <a2_0><a4_0>Charles Darrow<a4_0/><a2_0/> and thence Parker Brothers. It was not until <a3_0>1995<a3_0/> that Parker Brothers acknowledged this mistake and formally apologized to the residents of Marven Gardens for the misspelling although the spelling error was not corrected.
